newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev closes flat after rangebound trade.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev closes flat after rangebound trade.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed at 1,580-1,590 per dollar in thin interbank volume, little changed from 1,580-1,600 at the opening and flat on the previous close as dollar demand and supply were balanced, dealers said.
"Trade was lacklustre and rangebound throughout the day. The lev closes virtually unchanged from the opening," one dealer said.

Dollar supply came mainly from final clients aiming to improve lev liquidity under expectations of ongoing lev stability following a financial accord with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), traders said.

The central bank was seen buying dollars to boost its forex reserves ahead of the introduction of a tough fixed exchange rate mechanism, the currency board, and to prevent sharp lev gains amid the increased dollar supply, dealers said.
Central bank officials were not immediately available for comment.
The interim government and the IMF mission on Monday said they had reached an accord under which Bulgaria is to receive around $650 million to stabilise its shattered economy over the next year.
The IMF mission for Bulgaria leader Anne McGuirk said on Monday a currency board system would be introduced in June to restore confidence in the lev.
